swordandshield.models

Class Round

  • java.lang.Object
    • swordandshield.models.Round
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Round
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Created by Chris on 1/08/2017. Represents the game of Sword and Shield. This is instantiated every time a brand new game starts. It is the main model that updates the boardView
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • isPieceAtPos

        public boolean isPieceAtPos(int boardRow,
                            int boardCol)
        Checks if the coordinates are outside of the 10 x 10 grid or in the corners and if there if not, returns if there is a piece at the location
        Parameters:
        boardRow -
        boardCol -
        Returns:
        returns true if theres a piece at the location. Returns false if the position is out of bounds or there isn't a piece at the location

      • isPieceAtPos

        public boolean isPieceAtPos(Coord pos)

      • isPieceAtOffset

        public boolean isPieceAtOffset(Coord origPos,
                               java.lang.String dir,
                               int offset)

      • getPieceAtPos

        public Piece getPieceAtPos(int boardRow,
                           int boardCol)
        Gets the piece at the specified position if the position isn't outside the bounds of the 10 x 10 grid or in the corner 3 pieces
        Parameters:
        boardRow -
        boardCol -
        Returns:
        Piece or null (null if pos is out of bounds)

      • setPieceToPos

        public void setPieceToPos(Piece piece,
                          Coord pos)
        Depending on the position you pass in, it can do multiple things. If you are trying to place the piece on the Face position, it will put it in the cemetery for you. If the position is valid, i.e it's inside the grid, it will set the piece to the position that was passed in.
        Parameters:
        piece - Piece to set to the position
        pos - The position you want the piece to be set to

      • determineOffset

        public Coord determineOffset(Coord origPos,
                             java.lang.String dir,
                             int offset)
        Determines the coordinate of an offset away from an original position coordinate
        Parameters:
        origPos - the original coordinate you want to calculate the offset from
        dir - what direction (up, down, left, right)
        offset - how far away you want the offset from the original position
        Returns:
        Coordinate for offset from an original position

      • moveAdjacentPieces

        public void moveAdjacentPieces(int adjacentLength,
                               Coord origPos,
                               java.lang.String dir)
        Given the number of adjacent pieces to the original, it shifts the furthest piece away from the original piece by 1, and loops until it has moved itself by one.
        Parameters:
        adjacentLength - number of pieces adjacent to start piece, can be 0
        origPos - start piece location
        dir - direction to move all pieces

      • putPieceOnGrid

        public void putPieceOnGrid(Piece player)
        Only to be used when creating a piece, not to move. Removes piece from available pieces and puts it at the spawn point of the current player
        Parameters:
        player -

      • destroy

        public void destroy(Coord pos)
        Sets a piece at a specific position on the grid to null. Used when moving pieces (we destroy current position and assign new pos)
        Parameters:
        pos - Piece at position to destroy

      • getPlayerbyColor

        public Player getPlayerbyColor(Player.ColorIdentity col)
        Returns a player with a specified col token, throws a exception and breaks execution if a player with the color is not found.
        Parameters:
        col - Green/Yellow
        Returns:
        Player with that color token

      • isOutOfBoundsOnBoard

        public boolean isOutOfBoundsOnBoard(int boardRow,
                                    int boardCol)
        Returns whether the given x,y position on the grid is out of bounds. This does not include outside of the grid. These are the three positions in each corner of the 10x10 grid
        Parameters:
        boardRow -
        boardCol -
        Returns:

      • isFacePosition

        public boolean isFacePosition(int x,
                              int y)
        Returns a boolean if the given position is on one of the face positions.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        boolean if one of face positions

      • isSpawnPosition

        public boolean isSpawnPosition(int x,
                               int y)
        Returns true if the x/y position passed is one of the two players spawn positions
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:

      • setCloneFields

        public void setCloneFields(Round previousRound)
        Given a Round that should have been deep cloned, this will assign the fields of the current round to the fields of a previous state of the round. This is used for the undo functionality.
        Parameters:
        previousRound -

      • deepClone

        public Round deepClone()
        Used to deep clone this round object, everything that implements serializable will also be cloned. These clones are statically added to a stack of Rounds in Game and popped in run() upon receival of a valid user input command.
        Returns:
        Round object with all pointers separate to current object
